metadata.Description: The Climate Change Adaptation Framework is designed to help communities, governments, and businesses develop strategies to cope with the effects of climate change, such as increased extreme weather events, rising sea levels, and shifting climatic zones.

Climate Change Adaptation Framework.Description: The Framework integrates disaster risk management strategies to reduce the vulnerability of communities to climate-induced disasters.
The Framework enhances agricultural adaptation techniques to improve food security under changing climatic conditions.
The Framework secures water resources management by adapting to changing rainfall patterns and availability.
The Framework strengthens the resilience of infrastructure to withstand climatic impacts like flooding and heatwaves.
The Framework preserves and protects ecosystems, which are vital for biodiversity and human livelihoods, from the adverse effects of climate change.
The Framework focuses on public health by preparing health systems to manage the increased risks posed by climate change, such as disease outbreaks.
